Question 51) In general and fundamental sense, right is the technique of human coexistence, that is, the technique aimed at making possible the coexistence of men. As a technique, the law materializes in a set of rules (in this case, they are laws or standards); And such rules are intersubjective behavior, that is, the reciprocal behavior of men with each other.
ABBAGNANO, N. Philosophy Dictionary. SÃ£o Paulo: Martins Fontes, 2007.
The general and fundamental sense of law, as highlighted, refers to the
A) Application of legal codes.
B) regulation of social life.
C) legitimation of political decisions.
D) Mediation of economic conflicts.
E) representation of the constituted authority.
